title: Add top-nav Introduction page and ensure admin Works upload is discoverable

requirements.text: Create a new public-facing "Introduction" page/section that displays the user's provided introduction text (the self-introduction previously mentioned in conversation, e.g., identifying the author as Arya Singh and referencing the books "Waves of Kashi" and "Ashwathamaâ€™s Last Vow").

quotes: Yes and make a separate section of my introduction which i above mentioned
Yes at the top of site and I confirm

acceptanceCriteria: A new route exists for the Introduction page (e.g., /introduction) and renders a dedicated page with an H1 title "Introduction" and the introduction body text.
The Introduction page uses the existing long-form reading styles (consistent with other content pages, e.g., using the existing Prose component pattern).
All user-facing text on the page is in English.

requirements.text: Add an "Introduction" link as a top-level item in the main site navigation at the top of the site, and include it in the mobile menu as well.

quotes: Yes at the top of site and I confirm

acceptanceCriteria: The header navigation (desktop) shows an "Introduction" link and it appears before the existing primary sections (Research/Storytelling/Poetry).
The mobile navigation drawer also includes the "Introduction" link.
Clicking "Introduction" navigates to the Introduction page route and highlights as active when on that page.

requirements.text: Ensure authenticated admins can clearly find and use the Works upload flow by making the "Upload Work" option reliably visible and providing a clear navigation path from the Admin area to Works upload.

quotes: also how will i add my works because I don't get any option to add so also fix it

acceptanceCriteria: When logged in as an admin, the Admin area provides an obvious path to Works management and uploading (e.g., Admin Dashboard has a "Manage Works" action that leads to the Works admin page, and the Works admin page has a visible "Upload Work" button that navigates to the upload form).
The Admin Works upload form allows selecting a file and submitting, and on success returns to the Works admin list.
If the user is not logged in or not an admin, the UI clearly indicates that Works uploading requires admin access (using the existing AdminGuard/authorization messaging patterns).

requirements.text: Add the "Introduction" link to the site footer navigation alongside the existing public links.

quotes: Yes at the top of site and I confirm

acceptanceCriteria: Footer navigation includes an "Introduction" link that routes to the Introduction page.
All footer links remain functional and styling remains consistent with the existing footer design.

constraints: Backend must remain single-actor (all Motoko logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (shadcn components) or any paths listed in frontend.immutablePaths.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Adding new authentication providers beyond Internet Identity.
Changing backend data models for Entries or Works unless required to fix the missing upload option.
